availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George F. Barnes (Paducah, Kentucky, major in 12th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, soldier. Tennessee native. Son of A.J. Barnes and Martha Barnes. Married to Annamaria Robinson Barnes in Paducah on December 31, 1865. Student in Davidson County, Tennessee in 1850. Soldier in Paducah in 1863. Served in the 15th Kentucky Cavalry as 2nd lieutenant. Served in the 12th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as major from March 17, 1864 to August 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracekn County, Paducah, p. 115A.
U.S. Returns from Military Posts, 1806-1916Paducah, Kentucky, September 1861-December 1872, p. 96 of 274 microfilm, viewed on ancestry.com on January 12, 2021.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, McCracken County Marriages, Film #002135060, p. 422 of 726 microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 114.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #726853, Certificate #534689.
"Caused by Financial Troubles,"The Paducah Sun(Paducah, KY), November 5, 1898, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "Maj. George Foster Barnes (1836-1898)," Memorial #118355698, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118355698 (accessed December 9, 2020).
